pull.title: test: Fix AreInputsStandard test to reference the proper scriptPubKey
pull.body:
This value doesn't affect the outcome of the test, because the values are
properly set on line 351 (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13565/files#diff-b7061098b41bd31ef5db043705441133R351), but this makes the test values internally coherent.

This value doesn't affect the outcome of the test, because the values are
properly set on line 351, but this makes the test values internally coherent.

events.message:
Fix AreInputsStandard test to reference the proper scriptPubKey

This value doesn't affect the outcome of the test, because the values are
properly set on line 351, but this makes the test values internally coherent.

events.body: Alternatively, if there's a way to remove this apparently ineffectual reference, I'd be curious to hear it.

rename.from: Fix AreInputsStandard test to reference the proper scriptPubKey
rename.to: test: Fix AreInputsStandard test to reference the proper scriptPubKey

events.body: Adding @theuni as reviewer as he touched this line last.
Looks like it's been this way since introduction in 7f3b4e95695d50a4970e6eb91faa956ab276f161. I'm confused about why this works as-is though, am I missing something obvious?
It works as is, because the check is done on the redeemScript derived from the scriptSig `sixteenSigops` and not on the `scriptPubKey` of the coin.
